items.title: Notes hanging in Reaper (in Sfizz 1.2.3)
items.body:
Hi dear devs,

I just tried the new version of Sfizz 1.2.3 in my DAW.
I loaded a patch of Virtual Playing Orchestra and played a little. Soon there were hanging notes.
To test it, I returned to version 1.2.2. -> Loaded the same patch -> No hanging notes.
To be absolutely safe I retried version 1.2.3 and there were the hanging notes again.
So, I think there could be a relevant bug in 1.2.3 (perhaps in combination with Reaper).
For me no larger problem, because I use 1.2.2 as long as this is fixed.


my configuration:
Win 10 Pro
Reaper 7.11

Nevertheless hands up for this wonderful piece of software. Thanks devs !

items.title: Wrong ELF class: ELFCLASS32
items.body:
Hi
I am trying to run sfizz version raspbian 12 in Carla but when loading as a LV2 plugin it fails to load with error msg: Wrong ELF class: ELFCLASS32. Sfizz vst3 wont even show up in Carla plugin manager.
I have also tried running sfizz in Ardour7 just as a reference test - here it loads without errors but no UI is present so its unusable. Ardour plugin manager does show the vst3 version but error msg Invalid module path.
I have tried both 'stable' and 'current' but get the same results. 
Any help would be much appreciated.

items.title: VST3SDK: separated plugins CMake modules
items.body:
Attempt to simplify the CMake build configuration by keeping separated plugin scripts as modules:
- added `plugins/vst/cmake` to `CMAKE_MODULE_PATH`
- renamed `plugins/vst/cmake/Vst3.cmake` to `VST3SDK.cmake`
- extracted {VST2|VST3|AU}Plugin.cmake out from `plugins/vst/CMakeLists.txt`

this mainly to isolate and possibly ease the needed changes for the AU wrapper in a single place.

items.title: VST3SDK: update to 3.7.10_build_14
items.body:
Draft: the VST3SDK builds correctly, though I haven't tested yet the result. Other than that the usual issue with our static auwrapper that needs to be tested/modified by other macOS devs.

Note that in the `auwrapper` folder there is an include file, `docAUv2.h` which is only a Doxygen documentation file on how to use the wrapper. This file seems modified recently, describing a more simplified process to how to add the wrapper to the project by calling a CMake function.

I wonder if we could drop the old static version and adapt the CMake configuration to use the one in the SDK, to make things easier from now on.

Closes #126.

items.title: Ensure static or dynamically linking
items.body:
- Check plugins linking
- Add a `SFIZZ_USE_SYSTEM_LIBRARY` to disable the library build

items.title: Build leads to shared library and standalone
items.body:
Hi! :wave: 

When building 1.2.3 for Arch Linux I noticed, that the build and install targets lead to the shared library and the standalones to be built and installed.

I get the following files after picking out the plugin related files:
```
sfizz-ui-1.2.3-1-x86_64.pkg.tar.zst
-rw-r--r-- root/root      6819 2024-02-19 15:41 .BUILDINFO
-rw-r--r-- root/root      1058 2024-02-19 15:41 .MTREE
-rw-r--r-- root/root       937 2024-02-19 15:41 .PKGINFO
drwxr-xr-x root/root         0 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/
drwxr-xr-x root/root         0 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/bin/
-rwxr-xr-x root/root   1248888 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/bin/sfizz_jack
-rwxr-xr-x root/root   1437632 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/bin/sfizz_render
drwxr-xr-x root/root         0 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/include/
-rw-r--r-- root/root     41247 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/include/sfizz.h
-rw-r--r-- root/root     37450 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/include/sfizz.hpp
-rw-r--r-- root/root      3157 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/include/sfizz_message.h
drwxr-xr-x root/root         0 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/lib/
lrwxrwxrwx root/root         0 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/lib/libsfizz.so -> libsfizz.so.1
lrwxrwxrwx root/root         0 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/lib/libsfizz.so.1 -> libsfizz.so.1.2.3
-rwxr-xr-x root/root   1469208 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/lib/libsfizz.so.1.2.3
drwxr-xr-x root/root         0 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/lib/pkgconfig/
-rw-r--r-- root/root       255 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/lib/pkgconfig/sfizz.pc
drwxr-xr-x root/root         0 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/share/
drwxr-xr-x root/root         0 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/share/man/
drwxr-xr-x root/root         0 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/share/man/man1/
-rw-r--r-- root/root       585 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/share/man/man1/sfizz_jack.1.gz
-rw-r--r-- root/root       622 2024-02-19 15:41 usr/share/man/man1/sfizz_render.1.gz
```

I can of course remove those manually, but they should neither be built nor installed in this project.

Looking at what the created plugins link against, it appears those link against a static version of libsfizz.so.
Is this intended? Can this be changed?

items.title: vst3sdk out-of-date
items.body:
Hi! :wave: 

When getting around to create this package for Arch Linux finally I ran into issues with the bundled vst3sdk being too out-of-date:

```
CMake Error at plugins/editor/cmake/Vstgui.cmake:122 (target_sources):
  Cannot find source file:

    /usr/src/vst3sdk/vstgui4/vstgui/lib/platform/linux/cairocontext.cpp

  Tried extensions .c .C .c++ .cc .cpp .cxx .cu .mpp .m .M .mm .ixx .cppm
  .ccm .cxxm .c++m .h .hh .h++ .hm .hpp .hxx .in .txx .f .F .for .f77 .f90
  .f95 .f03 .hip .ispc
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  plugins/editor/CMakeLists.txt:9 (include)
```

We are currently on 3.7.9_build_61 and will update to 3.7.10_build_14. Would it be possible to bump the version used in this repository as well? :)

items.title: Avoid duplicated LV2 State Extension path mapping features
items.body:
Avoid duplicated LV2_State_{Map,Free}_Path features to eg. lilv_state_new_from_instance(), when and if already provided by the caller/host (eg. qtractor).

Resolves promised qtractor method to bundle all SFZ <region> files to an archive/zip (*.qtz) session file, an old feature
applicable to LV2 plugins.

See also: https://github.com/rncbc/qtractor/issues/427

items.title: ⚠️ Feature requests / questions go in Discussions ⚠️
items.body: To keep issues bug related only, we created the discussions' [Features section](https://github.com/sfztools/sfizz-ui/discussions/categories/requests), so please use it instead issues for feature requests.

items.title: Handle saved Windows paths on Unix
Add ability for universal plugin (intel/arm) build on macs
items.body:
Added new cmake option SFIZZ_MAC_UNIVERSAL_BINARY for enabling universal x86_64/arm64 build of plugins. It currently defaults to OFF, but you should set up the CI and release setups to enable it.

PLEASE NOTE, this needs the latest develop of sfizz that includes the fix for universal building.

android support
Unable to send project from Windows user to Linux user
items.body:
I seem to be running into an issue trying to send a project from a Windows user to a Linux user. The "User SFZ folder" is set correctly on both systems, and I can send projects from Linux to Windows with no issues whatsoever. However, when trying to send a project from Windows to Linux, the Linux user gets the full Windows style path of the soundfont in the soundfont selection region:
![01](https://github.com/sfztools/sfizz-ui/assets/42302369/8914a131-caf5-4ca9-84d3-621211a5c993)

Whereas I would expect simply the name of the file to show up like so (this is what happens when I send a project from Linux to Windows and it works perfectly!)
![02](https://github.com/sfztools/sfizz-ui/assets/42302369/8885823d-fdc7-4f70-a010-289a11f331ac)

Generally speaking I would expect users from all operating systems to be able to share projects without issue (as long as the "User SFZ folder" is set correctly of course!)
sfizz 1.2.1, DAW is reaper.

Linux version is Debian 12, Windows version is Windows 7 (apologies, that is what the user is using unfortunately).

If there are test builds for a bugfix, I am happy to test on my Linux system + Windows 7 vm.

items.title: LV2: Load/Open SFZ file/folder issues
items.body:
This at least on Linux:
- the LV2 file dialog opens by default in the sfizz plugin path, which is not great.
It would be nice to save somewhere the last used directory and open it instead.
- when trying to open the SFZ folder in the default file manager nothing happens

These 2 issues doesn't happen in VST3.

items.title: Missing dependencies on .deb in ubuntu repository
items.body:
I recently installed sfizz from the ubuntu repository on an ubuntu studio (23.04) freshly installed.
When I try to launch sfizz UI from ardour/mixbus, I had the following error displayed in the terminal and the UI not showing.

`suil error: Unable to open UI library /usr/lib/lv2/sfizz.lv2/Contents/Binary/sfizz_ui.so (/usr/lib/lv2/sfizz.lv2/Contents/Binary/sfizz_ui.so: undefined symbol: pango_font_metrics_get_height)`

after a little googling, it seemed that this dependency was provided by `libpango-perl` which I installed and solved the issue.

May you please add the dependency to the package in order it is automatically installed by apt ?

items.title: Sfizz Crashes with puredata when changing dsp status in external patch, assert faied !voice->isInSisterRing
items.body:
SFizz crashes puredata when you perform the following action with this This minimal reproduction:
[sfizz_reproduce.pd.gz](https://github.com/sfztools/sfizz-ui/files/12113676/sfizz_reproduce.pd.gz)
Steps:
1. Open the patch "pd testSubPatch" move the window somewhere else, then click into the main window.
2. Ensure Dsp is on (ctrl-/)
3. Hit the toggle switch above the "metro" object
4. Click into the other window
5. Turn Dsp off (ctrl-.)
6. Wait up to 30 seconds (rough estimate).

Output from Puredata:
```
Assert failed: !voice->isInSisterRing()
Assert failed at /usr/src/debug/sfizz/sfizz-1.2.1/src/sfizz/SisterVoiceRing.h:139
Trace/breakpoint trap (core dumped)
```

EDIT: Figured I should mention this patch I'm working on also crashes, but it does so faster, and with less work (just open it, and click the toggle above the tempo object). It requires the live coding toolkit (https://github.com/algomusic/Live-Coding-Toolkit-for-Pure-Data). It normally crashes after the clarinet starts. Here's the patch:
[try_canvas.pd.gz](https://github.com/sfztools/sfizz-ui/files/12131042/try_canvas.pd.gz)

items.title: Need documentation on what Midi CC messages that Sfizz can read
items.body:
Need documentation on the Midi CC messages  to which Sfizz is able listen and respond. For example:

Attack
Decay
Sustain
Release
Cut off (low pass filter)
Resonance 
Pitch wheel
Modulation wheel
Volume
Pan position
Portamento on/off
Portamento Time

Thanks!

items.title: Not able to reload or load preset
items.body:
Hello,

I'm using sfizz v1.2.1 (VST-3 format) on Arch Linux with Bitwig.

When I'm loading a new instance of sfizz everything works properly.

However, when I reload an existing instance (for example, when I open an existing project) or when I try to load a saved preset, bitwig is not able to load the plugin, with the error message:
`Could not load plugin
Plugin host died: Could not read async reply: End of stream`

It seems to me that it is linked to bitwig as I was not able to replicate to issue with Carla. However, Bitwig only behave like that with sfizz (not other VST3 plugins)

Any idea of what is happening?

Thanks a lot
